TopicTitle: Turn off part tint when overheating

Articles.Content:
When things get hot, they glow orange/red etc (this is not the debug colours available via F11). I'd like a mod that can remove that glow, or toggle it on/off if possible (via blizzys/stock toolbar?)

I'd love to take screenshots of my space station but the bugs regarding the thermal system means every parts temperature is infinity (when it really shouldn't be), which means screenshots just look awful. I'd love to document my trip to Eve and Duna, but the bugs with the thermal system make my microsats overheat which means the screenshots don't look that good.

Pretty please?
Claw's Stock Bugfix Modules deals with the infinite overheating glitch - I haven't had it since I installed it.

Claw's Stock Bugfix Modules deals with the infinite overheating glitch - I haven't had it since I installed it.

Not to my satisfaction. I have it and FAR installed and I still have to Ignore Max Temperature. Also, no amount of mods are going to lower a parts temperature from infinity, it's impossible. Once it's saved in the savefile, that's it. Every fix I've seen is more preventative than a cure.

Besides, this would still be useful during say, a nuclear engine burn, or coming to the end of a launch.. I think.. I just reckon it might be a neat little idea.

But yeah, that would be a nice mod for cinematics and screenshots.

That highlighting is actually highlighting, not glowing, and it's from the gauges. Turn off the gauges (KSP doesn't, in current release, have a way to individually toggle the gauges and the highlighting).
Removal of that horrendous heat glow has been high on my wish list for quite some time. I really hope it gets dealt with in the next update.

Turn off the gauges (KSP doesn't, in current release, have a way to individually toggle the gauges and the highlighting).

Nathan IS correct the glow is triggered by the temperature gauges.

If you keep the gauges suppressed with DMagic's Temperature Gauge Killer the glow won't appear. But as soon as you temporarily enable the temperature gauges ( F10 ) to do a quick check that fugly glow appears on overheated parts and stays there. Even after parts have cooled back down.
